Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: New York, as it turns out, is very expensive, and I ran out of money. I thought about selling a kidney, but Michael offered to get me a part-time job at corporate.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Of course, now Michael knows where to reach me 16 to 18 hours a week.

Quote.Speaker: Michael [on phone]
Quote.Text: Paaam-o-laaaaaa... Miss ya kiddo. Miss you... so much.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That was really fun last night.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm actually thinking about getting my own set of putt-putt golf clubs.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Oh, that would be great. You need that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I, uh... [to camera] I let her win.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So, when, um, can I see you again?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Um, tonight, I'm free tonight. Is that too eager? [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. Oh, wait, oh, tonight's no good. [Holly's smile quickly fades] Because I am busy taking you out.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: [gasps] Oh, I just remembered, I can't tonight.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wow... Oh, wait a second, I can't tonight...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Too many times. It's all good, um, alright, so, good, so, have a nice day.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: In my opinion, the third date is traditionally the one where... you have sex. Does Holly feel that way? I don't know. I will probably find out tonight. If she starts having sex with me I'll know for sure.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: That's for you. And, um, oh. I am right in assuming that Dwight is short for D-Money. 'Cause that's what I wrote on your save-the-date.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: J-Money. Or should it be T-Money, for Tuna? Receptionist Money. K-Money.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: You're making a knife with a knife?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: You want to talk about it?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: You know I know. [looks at the camera guys] You know they know.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I know none of that. If I did, you'd be the last to know.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Oh, the mall could be fun.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: We could go to the food court and get different foods. You could get Chicken Teriyaki. I could get a hot dog.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Some of what we order depends on whether we're having sex after. [laughs] Oh, my. Wow, elephant in the room. Are we, do you think? Do you think we're going to have sex tonight?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, so, we do the restaurant thing and then... then... then we can do... We'll just do the restaurant thing first.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Probably get soup or something light.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: She introduced me to so many things. Pasteurized milk, sheets, monotheism, presents on your birthday, preventative medicine.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: It's nice to learn new things.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Angela's not really a risk taker. And Andy's not really a risk.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. No. Reservations are at 8:00, so we've got like an hour and 45 minutes. [sighs] [goofy voice] I'm a crazy eight, I'm crazy.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: [walking out of the building] Oh, I forgot my keys.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Oh, after vous. [walking into the girls bathroom]

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: I didn't forget my keys, I just didn't want to make out with you in front of the cameras. Do you think they can hear us?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Not if we turn these dials [getting louder] all the way down. [whispering] Now they can't hear us at all.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Yes, that's correct. I need to cancel checks from 10,001 to 90,000.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah, well, they stole my surge protector.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oscar, I'm now going to be prone to surges.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Bravo, Watson. Looks like a classic seven-man job. Okay, security tapes were stolen, Motives-financial, or possible, vintage HP computer collectors. Hank down at security had clocked out. And that's all we have.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Can I talk to you for a second?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: That wasn't us, right? I mean... you remembered to lock the doors?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Michael I think this is our fault.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So much for sex without consequences.

Quote.Speaker: Pam [on phone]
Quote.Text: [Jim holds up phone] You are such a dork! Shots!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So apparently Pam went out last night, and accidentally called my work phone at 3:00 in the morning.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm on minute six of this message.

Quote.Speaker: Pam [on phone]
Quote.Text: Okay, I do not sound like that.

Quote.Speaker: Man on phone
Quote.Text: You can take the girl out of Philly...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: The future mother of my children.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You're always safe with me. I'm a very good screamer. And one day, we're going to move to Disney's Celebration Village in Florida and leave all of this behind.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I would very much like that.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I know she loves me, Phyllis. I am sure of it. She practically told me so.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Then you need to give her an ultimatum. Tell her she needs to make a choice. You or Andy. If she pick you, great. If not, you can move on.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Are you sure that's going to work?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: It did when Bob said I had to stop talking to my sister on the phone so much.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wait, this isn't our floor. Dwight...

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: How's everyone doing? My door is always open if anyone wants to talk.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I don't want to talk. I want my laptop back.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Nobody steals from Creed Bratton and gets away with it. The last person to do this disappeared. His name? [whispering] Creed Bratton.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We're gonna make everything all right. Alright? Conference room, 15 minutes. Half an hour. Alright?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: To recoup their losses, I am planning a little charity auction, where people from all over Scranton can come and bid on our goods and services. I'm calling it crime-aid. It's like farm aid, but instead of farms fighting against AIDS, it is us fighting against our own poverty.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I think it's a fun idea.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: We could auction off things we do for each other like cleaning or tennis lessons. My sorority did it all the time.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, I'm gonna have to stop you right there. Was this a sorority that you didn't get into a real sorority so you had to kind of form your own?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. Okay! Well, come on, let's have an auction. Let's do this. We'll auction off people like in the olden days.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: So, in order to recoup the value of items we liked, we have to spend more money on things we don't want. Who would ever come to this?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't know, it could be any number of people. It could be a pedestrian. It could be an old person. It could be a lookie-loo. Or, it could be... a Bruce Springsteen fan - what? Who said that? I did. Why did I say that? Oh, I think you know why I said that. I think it is very apparent. I think it goes without saying. Bear with me. There's a point there. But what is the point? I don't understand what he's saying. It seems a little shady. It seems a little foggy. Well, it's not a little foggy there's actually something going on here-

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Do you need us for any of this?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Michael scored the big ticket item. Springsteen tickets! The boss scored the boss.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, I think that's pretty boss.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: He knows how to get things. He got me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Listen to me close. 'Cause I'm only gonna say this once. You either break off your engagement with that singing buffoon, apologize, and then date me, or you can say good-bye to this. [points below his belt]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I think you have me confused with another person.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I said I was only gonna say this once. You have until 6:14 PM. 6:14!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pump it up! Yeah! Yeah! Yeah! [Huey Lewis' Heart of Rock and Roll plays] Pump up the volume. Thank you very much, everybody. Thank you, Mr. Springsteen. [music stops] And welcome to C.R.I.M.E.-A.I.D. [clears throat] Crime Reduces Innocence Makes Everyone Angry I Declare. It is not known how many office robberies occur every second because there is no Wikipedia entry for office robbery statistics. However, tonight, its victims, are standing together and standing strong in the form of song, cooking lessons, and hugs. Really Phyllis? You're auctioning a hug? Okay, so with no further ado, lights, camera, auction! Take it away Bruce! [Huey Lewis' Heart of Rock and Roll plays]

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Mike gave me a list of his top ten Springsteen songs. Three of them were Huey Lewis and the News. One was Tracy Chapman, Fast Car. And my personal favorite, Short People.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, this is the moment that you have all been waiting for. Our first item up for bids tonight is something that I consider to be very boss indeed. [cheers and applause] It is a Yoga lesson from Holly Flax! Yoga! And I would like to start the bidding off at 300 dollars. [auctioneer voice] 300 dollars do I hear 300 dollars? 300 dollars. Hey, batter batter batter, hey batter, swing batter, 300 dollars, 300 dollars, 300 dollars. Anybody, 300 dollars. 400 dollars. Who wants for 400-[speaking gibberish] Do I see somebody in the back? Is there somebody in the back? Do I see somebody in the back? 400-450 [speaking gibberish] Sold! For 300 dollars to me! [bangs gavel, which squeaks] What the hell is that?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: It's the only gavel I could find.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It squeaks when you bang it, that's what she said. Let's hear it for me! Right? A bargain at any price!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, yes, great. Very good, Um, so, Darryl, and the boys in the hood in the warehouse, have graciously donated to, uh, go out for a beer with them right now. You know what, I'm actually going to bid on this. I'm going to start the bidding, because this is something that I have dreamt of-

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Mike, you can't do that. It's conflict of interest.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. Okay, sold! Have fun, you guys. Well, this next item is sure to spring steam from your ears if you don't win it. It just says "Creed."

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Another round, boys? Great. [Jim walks to the bar]

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: I'm not gonna hit you or anything.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Hey, what's up, guys? How you been?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Hi, I'm Kevin. And I'll do your taxes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Let's hear an opening bid, everybody. Who's first? Kevin do your taxes. He's the tax man. Kevin the tax man.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Fine. [throws down microphone, knocks down microphone stand]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, alright. Hey, you know what? I would appreciate it if people would stop storming off the stage.

Quote.Speaker: Hank [the security guard]
Quote.Text: [playing blues on a guitar] Me and the blues. It's me and the blues. [Dwight looks at his watch, then at Angela, who looks away from Dwight towards Andy]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We are getting there folks. Slow and steady. [David Wallace walks in] Well, well, have we been blessed today. Ladies and gentlemen, Mr. David Wallace! Whoo!

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: Thank you Michael, thanks, thanks everybody. I'd like to auction off a weekend at my place in Martha's Vineyard. Hey, hey!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey Phyllis, someone let the air out of your tires. Come quick.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Keep it going. Hey batter batter batter.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I had to get your attention. This is an emergency. [the air is let out of one of Phyllis' tires]

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Why couldn't have you just said it? Why did you actually do it?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Listen, she ignored my ultimatum. Now what?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, fine. I've moved on. Now how do I get her back?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Well Dwight, I don't think you do. I think you've got your answer.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wait, that's it? That's your advice? I thought you had some kind of big master plan.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Well, I just think we all deserve to be with someone who wants to be with us.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh. I get it. You're trying to secure your place as head of the party-planning committee. You're just being selfish. [Phyllis slaps Dwight] And you slap like a girl.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What did Phyllis do wrong? I'll tell you what Phyllis did wrong. She stuck her nose into my business and tried to help me. [Dwight has an epiphany]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: She's, um, she's in New York. She's at an art school.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, I'd say she's happy. I mean, she loves her classes. Loves the city. I mean, last night, she was out with her friends, till, like, 8:00 AM.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: I thought you were a friend.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [driving] I am going to see Pam. Because I feel like I should. [sighs]

Quote.Speaker: Bob
Quote.Text: When are you getting to Bruce?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh, just a few more items.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right, all right, all right, all right, all right! Here we go. All right, big ticket item. [cheering] All right, in my pocket, I have... two tickets... to Mr. Bruce Springsteen, front... Oh, where are those? Has anyone seen an envelope with Bruce Springsteen front row tickets and backstage passes? Anybody seen something like-lying around?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Do you want us to look for 'em?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. I think they were stolen. I think they were stolen and they're gone forever. So... oh, that was the last good item. So, good job, everybody.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, well, Phyllis, nobody... really wants a hug, so.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh, what the hell is happening?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I need a hug, unless you're gonna give me one.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: 300, we have 300. 300 going once. 300 going twice.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: 300 and one penny, 300 and one penny.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: 500 and one penny. One million dollar!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: 1,000 going once, 1,000 going twice. Sold for 1,000 dollar. [applause] Nicely done.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [driving, sighs, laughs] No. you know what? No. Because... I'm not that guy. And [laughs] we are not that couple. [turns around]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [whispering] Hey, that looks good. Listen, about the tickets. It's sort of a gray-kind of a gray area in terms of...whether or not I had them- [Holly covers Michaels mouth]

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: The Springsteen tickets seemed too good to be true. But, a lot of Michael seems too good to be true. So far it's all true. But yeah, those tickets, really seemed too good to be true.

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: [after accidentally seeing Michael and Holly kiss] No, I did not know that Michael was dating Holly.
